name: One Minute Fly
description:
ONE MIN FLY is a small game for LD50, inspired by “One Minute Fly” animation by Michael Reichert. In this game we play as a fly who has a not very long list of things to do before death, and only 60 seconds to live. It seems impossible to check all of the goals in one’s lifetime. However it can mate with other flies and create descendants, so the goals can be fulfilled by them. Can it live life to its fullest or should it leave unfinished jobs to its descendants? How many generations does it take to live a full life? :D

Controls

The game is played with a keyboard, using arrow keys along with ‘F’, ‘T’.

You can move the fly around with arrows, use ‘F’ to interact with interactable objects, and hold ‘T’ to check the list of goals. You can also press ‘H’ to view a Help menu.

Credits

  • Game is made with unity
  • We used LDtk for 2D map
  • Music on the main menu is “Flight of the Bumblebee” by Rimsky Korsakov.
